dct_title_s: Orbis terrarum nova et accuratissima tabula
dct_description_sm: California shown as a labeled island with a flat northern coast and some coastal place names.
Both hemispheres geographically follow Visscher and Blaeu.
Includes polar maps in lower corners.
Title in round cartouche at upper left and in Dutch at upper right.
Hemispheres surrounded by sun at top with flying birds and an allegorical scene at bottom. Angels blowing winds on either side.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
